TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the ORG by Mr J. Unterweger , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

In DATE the PERSON company , i.e. a big NORP steel company , was taken over by the A. holding . On DATE , in the course of the negotiations preceding the take - over , PERSON , a businessman and president of the executive board of the A. holding , gave a written assurance that there would be no reduction in personnel at the NORP site of the PERSON company within DATE . On CARDINAL DATE the assurance was repeated in the records of a meeting between GPE , the executive manager of the PERSON company , staff representatives and representatives of several banks .
On DATE the ORG company announced staff cuts of CARDINAL employees , including CARDINAL dismissals to be carried out at the company 's NORP site .
On DATE the applicant , in his capacity as a member of parliament , namely as spokesperson for social affairs of ORG , issued a press release under the heading :
“ Massive Staff Cuts in GPE Alarming ” ( “ Massive PERSON in GPE bedenklich ” )
The press release included the following statement :
“ ORG 's plans which include staff cuts and the shut down of ORG 's NORP site constitute a clear breach of [ his ] promise given in public on the occasion of the takeover . ”
The above statement was reported in a number of DATE newspapers .

Thereupon , ORG brought injunction proceedings under LAW ) against the applicant with ORG ( ORG ) . He requested that the latter be prohibited from stating or repeating that he “ had broken his word with regard to his policy of no staff cuts as announced in DATE ” . He also requested that the statement be retracted and that this retraction be published in specified NORP DATE newspapers .

On DATE ORG granted the injunction . It ordered the applicant not to repeat the impugned statement and to publish a retraction in the newspapers requested at his own cost . The court found that , contrary to the applicant 's assertion , his statement was not a valuejudgment made in a political context , but a statement of fact , which jeopardised ORG 's reputation as a business man . In this respect , the court also noted that PERSON was not a politician and that , according to the written statement of DATE , the latter had only promised to make no staff cuts for DATE . Given the lack of precision regarding the time - frame it could not be assumed that the promise to make no staff cuts covered DATE . Thus , the allegation that ORG had broken his word , by announcing in DATE that he intended to dismiss employees , was not supported by evidence .

The applicant appealed against the injunction . He submitted that ORG had not assessed the relevant facts against the background of the economic development of the PERSON company and that the impugned statement constituted a value - judgment .

On DATE ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) dismissed the appeal . It considered that ORG had correctly assessed the relevant facts . Observing in particular that the applicant had himself failed to make any reference to the economic situation of the PERSON company in the material press release , it found , with reference to that text , that the only question at stake was whether PERSON , by announcing staff cuts , had broken his word . In this respect , ORG confirmed ORG view that the impugned statement was a statement of fact . Referring to the written statement of DATE , according to which there would be no reduction in manpower for DATE , it considered that the claimant 's “ guarantee ” had lasted until DATE at the very most and concluded that the applicant had failed to prove his allegation .
On DATE the applicant introduced an extraordinary appeal on points of law ( außerordentliche Revision ) against ORG decision .

On DATE ORG ( Oberster Gerichtshof ) declared the extraordinary appeal inadmissible as it found that the qualification of the statement at issue as a statement of fact was in accordance with its previous case - law . This decision was served on the applicant on DATE .
Article CARDINAL of LAW ( Allgemeines Bürgerliches Gesetzbuch ) provides as follows :
“ ( CARDINAL ) Everyone who has suffered material damage or loss of profit because of an insulting statement may claim compensation .

( CARDINAL ) The same applies if anyone disseminates statements of fact which jeopardise another person 's credit , gain or livelihood and if the untruth of the statement was known or must have been known to him . In such a case the retraction of the statement and the publication thereof may also be requested ... ”
